net.proteusframework.core.mail

Interface MailDataHandler

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public interface MailDataHandler
extends AutoCloseable
    A DataHandler specific to mail messages. This is used for on-demand message building and data interchange.

    Implementations of the interface should return the Objects from the get methods on demand if possible. Implementations do not have to be thread-safe.

    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
        Releases this MailDataHandler from service. Any open connections, file-descriptors, Iterables, etc, should be cleaned up at this point. Any use of them by MailDataHandlers after close is called is undefined.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • getAttachments

        Iterable<MailPart> getAttachments()
                                  throws MailDataHandlerException
        Gets the attachments of the message.
        Returns:
        The attachments. Never null.
        Throws:
        MailDataHandlerException - All Exceptions should be caught and wrapped in a MailDataHandlerException and thrown.

      • getAttribute

        @Nullable
Object getAttribute(Object key)
        Get an attribute from the handler.
        Parameters:
        key - the key.
        Returns:
        the attribute value or null.

      • getSubjectEncoding

        Returns:
